column4: that is change all the instances of warty in /etc/apt/sources.list to hoary
i must be the only one on earth with this problem. theres nothing on ebay and noone knows
i LOVE ubuntu but I'm going to end up back on gentoo just because i can't see my consol.
sorry, what do you mean?
ctrl-alt-F* does nothing?
don't you get a white prompt on a black background?
i get white text through about half of the boot process but sometime before i get a login prompt it gets real dark
maybe try sudo dpkg-reconfigure console-data
thanks for the try :) it just offered to change my keymap
sudo -s
good luck with your config files :/
why not alias them?
OK that's useful
:) thanks but i almost NEVER enable gdm. i wrote the script, did ./gdm-startup remove and have never used it again :)
for instance I have alias aterm='aterm +sb -tr -sh 80 -rv'
yes, for some things - scripts are better for bigger stuff
you could probably still alias those but I doubt it's worth it
of course - where have you been *grin*
I've seen unix gurus from the 70s say " I didn't know you could do that!"
*nix is endless learning
exactly
